website_summaries.verdict: The construction of the Crossknit 3.0 keeps in mind all the challenges encountered by golfers. Because golfers go through 18 holes while walking on different terrains, comfort is a feature that it provides. The water-resistant upper, stable sole, and spikeless but grippy outsole are well appreciated by its users. Because of the positive feedback garnered by this shoe, it is safe to say that it has hit its hole in one.
pros: Almost all of those who reviewed the Adidas Crossknit 3.0 would recommend the shoe to anyone
A high number of testers have found this shoe comfortable throughout the 18 holes
The selection of colorways and design appeals to several consumers
The lugs are composed of a hard-wearing rubber which provides traction when teeing off and walking on the course, says a significant amount of wearers
The composition of the soles is moderately stiff to provide stability to the foot, according to a few purchasers
One purchaser appreciates the spikeless construction because it minimizes the need to change shoes after the game
cons: An expert reviewer says that its style only caters to a niche audience
It will most likely not appeal the older market of golfers
An individual hopes that this Adidas golf shoe be waterproof instead of water-resistant

customer_reviews.title: Adidas Boost is the best cushion
customer_reviews.text: Loved them. I bought the New Balance LinksSL and they rubbed my toes and my feet hurt had to return them. I have the ecco biom boa's and they hurt my feet when I started walking courses. So I was looking for a new pair. These are the best shoes I've ever used to walk a course. I trust Adidas Boost the most of all the brands for cushioning when you walk a course. You won't be disappointed. I have fairly wide feet and these fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua McLean

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable on the golf course
customer_reviews.text: I love the styling. I thought at first the shoes were too tight although it was stated to be the same size as other of my shoes. I thought of returning it but decided to wear them on the golf course. They felt great! A larger size wouldn't have been nearly as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable golf shoe yet
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. And it has nice grip on the ground during the swing.
customer_reviews.author: Stowe Harbin

customer_reviews.title: SO COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: SUPER COMFORTABLE!!!! First round in these today. I am a huge ultraboost fan, i found them extremely comfortable. The sole grips really well even on harder tee box shots. Very satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason B Robb

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The tongue is not sewn correctly and digs into my foot. Adidas won't replace the shoes even though they are unwearable and Amazon won't help me either. Really disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Souza

customer_reviews.title: Adidas 3.0 cross knits are golden!
customer_reviews.text: These grip well and are comfortable while walking and swinging. Love the ultra boost fit. I’m very picky and the comfort of this golf shoe is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Rob H.

customer_reviews.title: Best golf shoes I have found.
customer_reviews.text: Very athletic fit. Great traction, plenty of stability and really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and grippy!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to walk the course. I played at 8AM today with wet grass and had zero issues with grip. Probably the most comfortable shoes I've owned. I'm very happy I went with these!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Colson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and great shoe to walk in. However, they're not very waterproof and parts of the sole started to come apart after just about 6 rounds played
customer_reviews.author: Van Levier

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable golf shoe, right out of the box. Great price. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: William Morris

customer_reviews.title: golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: Everythingis good. However, this shoes is little narrow for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chul S.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, true to size. Very comfortable. Have received a lot of compliments on them.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Kelver

customer_reviews.title: wish they still came in all black
customer_reviews.text: all black with black soles much better. still very comfy
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap build quality for an Adidas product
customer_reviews.text: Sole started stripping away from shoe almost immediately. If you move your foot sideways in golf or disc golf, this shoe cannot handle the torque. I recommend bumping up to a Terrex soled shoe instead, this isn’t for game play, maybe okay for walking?
customer_reviews.author: Echo Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Tip o the hat
customer_reviews.text: I like the green soles and they’re super compfy, beats a regular set of golf cleats any day.
customer_reviews.author: C note

customer_reviews.title: My golfer husband is not fond of this shoe.
customer_reviews.text: My husband walks when he plays golf so having a comfortable shoe is a must. He did not like the fit of this shoe. It's too narrow and puts pressure in the wrong places. That's too bad because he really likes the style/look of it. He said it seems to be well made and stable in the golf swing but would only wear it if he rode in a cart, which he seldom does. It's not an expensive shoe and it may fit others perfectly. May be worth a try unless you have a wide foot.
customer_reviews.author: Heather LaRee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This Adidas Men's Crossknit 3.0 Golf Shoe is very well made. They have a nice design and look really cool. I found the pair of shoes to fit well and to be rather comfortable. They don't hurt my feet after wearing them for long periods either. These are very nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Borgman

customer_reviews.title: great comfortable golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great golf shoes. They are super comfortable. The soles are nice and thick and they have great traction for teeing off and walking down the fairway. They fit perfectly and are true to size and are comfortable through 18 holes! Overall, great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: nice looking and very stable golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look great. They are lightweight, but still water-resistant. The shoes are spike-less, but still have hard rubber cleats to give me traction on the course. The soles are moderately stiff and very stable. Sizing feels a little smaller than Nike or Under Armour and a little bigger than New Balance, at least on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: l2

product_meta.title: adidas Men's Crossknit 3.0 Golf Shoe
product_meta.description: These men's golf shoes are built for stability and fit. They feature a lightweight heathered upper and a custom lacing pattern. A boost midsole returns energy on every swing. The puremotion outsole offers exceptional flexibility and grip for 18 holes.
feature_bullets: Lace closure with reflective laces and internal lace loops
Spikeless Puremotion outsole for enhanced flexibility and grip and durable Adiwear outsole
Forefoot polyurethane stability welds with external TPU stability heel counter and Torsion System stability bar
